sect1.title: Firewall Configuration
sect1.para: &susefirewall; has been replaced by &firewalld; starting with &productname; 15 GA15.0. Profiles using &susefirewall; properties will be translated to &firewalld; profiles. However, not all profile properties can be converted. For details about &firewalld;, refer to .

important.title: Limited Backward Compatibility with SuSEFirewall2 Based Profiles
important.para: The use of &susefirewall; based profiles will be only partially supported as many options are not valid in &firewalld; and some missing configuration could affect your network security.

sect2.title: General Firewall Configuration
sect2.para: In &firewalld; the general configuration only exposes a few properties and most of the configuration is done by zones.

entry.para: Whether &firewalld; should be started right after applying the configuration.
Whether &firewalld; should be started on every system startup.
The default zone is used for everything that is not explicitly assigned.
Type of dropped packages to be logged
Enable logging of dropped packages for the type selected. Values: off, unicast, multicast, broadcast, all.
Used to identify a zone. If the zone is not known yet, a new zone will be created.
Briefly summarizes the purpose of the zone. Ignored for already existing zones. If not specified, the name is used.
Describes the purpose of the zone. Ignored for already existing zones. If not specified, the name is used.
Defines the default action in the zone if no rule matches. Possible values are ACCEPT, %%REJECT%%, DROP and default. If not specified, default is used. For details about values, see .

sect2.title: Firewall Zones Configuration
sect2.para: The configuration of &firewalld; is based on the existence of several zones which define the trust level for a connection, interface or source address. The behavior of each zone can be tweaked in several ways although not all the properties are exposed yet.

entry.para: List of interface names assigned to this zone. Interfaces or sources can only be part of one zone.
List of services accessible in this zone.
List of single ports or ranges to be opened in the assigned zone.
List of protocols to be opened or be accessible in the assigned zone.
It will enable or disable network address translation (NAT) in the assigned zone.

sect2.title: Installation Stages When the &firewalld; Profile is Applied
sect2.para: Starting with &productname; 15 SP3, the &firewalld; profile is completely applied at the end of the first stage of the installation in most cases. (To learn about the installation stages, see .) However, there are circumstances where the profile is applied in the second stage. The following list specifies the conditions under which the &firewalld; profile is applied in the first or second stage:

listitem.para: You are running &ay; with a &firewalld; section, and not installing &slea; over SSH or VNC. The firewall is configured in the first stage.
You are running &ay; with a &firewalld; section, installing &slea; over SSH or VNC, and no second stage is required. The firewall is configured in the first stage.
You are running &ay; with a &firewalld; section, installing &slea; over SSH or VNC, and the second stage is required. The firewall is configured in the second stage.
You are running &ay; without a &firewalld; section. The firewall is configured in the first stage according to the default product proposals.

You are running &ay; with or without a firewall section, together with custom script which requires network access. The firewall is configured in the first stage either according to the profile or the product proposals, and the firewall configuration must be adapted so that the custom script has network access as needed.

sect2.title: A Full Example
sect2.para: A full example of the firewall section, including general and zone specific properties could look like this.

example.title: Example firewall section
example.screen: <firewall> <enable_firewall config:type="true">true</enable_firewall> <log_denied_packets>all</log_denied_packets> <default_zone>external</default_zone> <zones config:type="list"> <zone> <name>public</name> <interfaces config:type="list"> <interface>eth0</interface> </interfaces> <services config:type="list"> <service>ssh</service> <service>dhcp</service> <service>dhcpv6</service> <service>samba</service> <service>vnc-server</service> </services> <ports config:type="list"> <port>21/udp</port> <port>22/udp</port> <port>80/tcp</port> <port>443/tcp</port> <port>8080/tcp</port> </ports> </zone> <zone> <name>dmz</name> <interfaces config:type="list"> <interface>eth1</interface> </interfaces> </zone> </zones> </firewall>
